newsitem.title: GERMANY: Aero Lloyd adds Mediterranean, north Europe flight.
newsitem.headline: Aero Lloyd adds Mediterranean, north Europe flight.

text.p: German holiday carrier Aero Lloyd said it will add new destinations in the Mediterranean and northern Europe this summer.
The private airline will fly weekly to the southern Italian resort of Lamezia Terme, Jerez in Spain and Larnaca from several German airports, a statement said.
Aero Lloyd will add the new destinations of Tromso, Bodo, Lakselv and Fagernes in Norway from June, it added.
The fourth-largest German holiday carrier will also operate weekly flights from Munich to Cairo and from Frankfurt to Reykjavik.
Services to Israel will be increased this summer with twice-weekly flights from Munich to Tel Aviv and a weekly service to Eilat.
In all, Aero Lloyd will fly from 19 airports in Germany, Austria and Luxemburg to 63 destinations in 15 countries this summer.
It has a fleet of 21 aircraft with six Airbus A320s and 15 McDonnell Douglas MD-83s.
- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom. Tel +44 171 542 7706; Fax: 5017
